feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Analytics Cloud, connectivity
feed.subtitle: SAP Analytics Cloud, connectivity Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: IAS - SAC Role Maping
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I have the following scenario: Azure as the IdP, IAS as a proxy, and SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC).

My want is to implement IAS in a way that Azure AD groups are mapped to SAC teams, and then assign the corresponding SAC roles via SAML mapping.
For example: Azure group sac_adm → SAC team sac_adm → SAML mapping assigns the sac_adm role.

However, I have a few SAC teams where users within the same team need to have different roles in SAC.
How can this be achieved — having one team, but users within that team with different SAC roles?

 

Many Thanks

Best regards

entry.title: Story Report on Timesheet information
entry.content:
Hello experts,

I'm building a story report in SAP SuccessFactors that should display some information that exists in Time Sheet.

An example:

This is the the record on January 2nd and as you can see, there is no information  besides the time type and the hours. However, in the story report I have information that should not be there for that same user.

Do you have any idea of what is wrong on the configuration of the story report?

As of today, the data source is currently like that:

Thank you in advance for any feedback that you can share.

1.Job Information Query

2.Compensation Query

entry.title: Unable to set a connection from SAP Analytics Cloud to PostgreSQL 17 through JDBC Driver
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community, 

we are currently not able to set a connection in import from PostgreSQL 17 Database to SAC. In the official documentation seems that only version until 13 is currently supported. Is there any workaround to handle it?

SAP Analytics Cloud PostgreSQL on SAP BTP, hyperscaler option

entry.title: SAC manual import and conenction with Live data
entry.content:
Hello,

 

I am reaching out to seek your advice on the best practices for importing manual data into SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) on a monthly basis and subsequently joining this data with live SAP data connections. Specifically, I have a few questions that I would appreciate your insights on:

  1. Optimal Storage Path for Manual Data:

    • Could you recommend the most suitable storage path for the manual data? For instance, would using Google Drive or another cloud storage service be ideal for this purpose? I am looking for a solution that ensures easy access and integration with SAC.

  2. Best Medium for Automatic Data Integration:

    • What would be the best medium to automatically join the manual data with the live SAP data every month? The structure of the manual data will remain consistent, with only the values changing each month. I am interested in a method that minimizes manual intervention and ensures seamless integration.

  3. Monthly Data Refresh:

    • Both the manual data and the live SAP data will need to be refreshed once a month. Could you provide guidance on the most efficient way to set up this monthly refresh for both data sources within SAC?


#SAC #SACSTORY #SAP #SAPANALYTICAL

entry.title: Analytics Cloud & Business ByDesign Business Content (AP-RC-ANA-SAC) Errors in queries & import jobs
entry.content:
Hi, everyone.

I am currently trying to implement the SAP Business ByDesign business content (AP-RC-ANA-SAC) available in SAP Analytics Cloud. I am using the connector that comes with this business content (SAP_BYD_CONNECTOR), but I am having a problem with some model import jobs. Namely, the premade import jobs for models SAP__BYD_FI_ORDERPROFIT and SAP__BYD_FI_EARNEDPROFIT do not work. They provide the following error: The freehand query is not an entity set or function import" when creating a new Freehand query in SAC

 

I tried remaking the import jobs myself, by copying a query from a model. In the image below, after pressing next with this or a similar configuration, I am met with an infinite loading screen.

 

Thus, I tried making a new query. The problem is that the the tables for the two aforementioned models, RPFINPRFU30_Q0004QueryResults and RPFINPRFU30_Q0006QueryResults, are not visible in the list of tables, no matter what I do.

 

 

Do you have any advice on what I need to do in order to get access to these tables? My knowledge of ByDesign is quite limited, but the connector in SAC seems to be implemented correctly. I also should have access to Corporate Performance Analytics, since this connector does not return an authentication error.


...sapbydesign.com/sap/byd/odata/cpm_corporateperformance_analytics.svc

entry.title: SSO Live Connection from SAC to HANA using CIS getting error
entry.content:
Hi expert,

I tried to create a Live Connection from SAP Analytics Cloud to SAP HANA using Connection Type Direct ( I use this Type because I want to use Smart Insight Feature of SAC) and Authentication Method SAML Single Sign On (SSO). I use SAP Cloud Identity Service (CIS) as an IdP. I followed all the instructions but still can not create a Connection. I enabled the SAML in SAP HANA Studio and also mapped the External Identity (see the images below):

Then I went to SAC to create a connection:

When I hit the OK button, a pop-up appeared and redirected to the IdP log in link and I get the error:

Then I checked the Chrome Developers Tools and get the logs:

I already added the "Access-Control-Allow-Origin" in Allowed Header and Exposed Header in sap.bc.ina.service.v2 in XS Admin Tool. 
Which configs am I missing? 
Thank you experts,

Regards,

Thanh Hieu

entry.title: SAC Planning with connection to ERP System
entry.content:
Hello Together,

has anyone done planning in SAC (e.g., cost center planning) with a connection to the SAP ERP system? When connected to the S/4 system, can the actual transaction data from the ACDOCA table be imported into SAC. From SAC, the data can be transferred to the S/4 ACDOCP table. Is it also possible to export the transaction data to the ERP system? To which tables? Is there also a standard ODATA service?

BR

Marm

entry.content:
I have a REST API in SuccessFactors and I need to consume its data in a SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC). I have successfully created a import connection, but when trying to import the data, I am unable to see the desired data (employee compensation). I can see the data in POSTMAN. 

Please help me to fix this issue.

entry.title: Adding Custom Tooltips or Popups for Comments/Links in Table Cells in SAP Analytics Cloud Story
entry.content:
Hey everyone!

I want to allow users to enter information (like a comment, explanation, or external link) that will not be visible in the main table, but instead will only appear:

  • When the user actively clicks a specific button

  • Or, when clicking on a specific cell or icon within the cell

This would ideally open a popup or floating window that displays the hidden content — like a comment or hyperlink — without cluttering the table itself.

My question:

Is there a way in SAP Analytics Cloud to implement such a mechanism?
Either through scripting, pop-up logic on onSelect events, or a custom widget?
I'd love to hear how others may have handled similar needs for clean tables with context hidden behind user interaction.

Thanks in advance for any tips, examples, or directions!

Best regards,
Elad Tayar

entry.title: How to Compare versions by selecting manually
entry.content: "I have four public versions: two are Forecast and two are Budget. I want to use two separate input controls, one to display only the Forecast versions, and another to display only the Budget versions. The user should be able to manually select one Forecast version and one Budget version from the respective input controls to compare between one forecast and one budget in a table."

entry.title: End-user consumption of Datasphere data in SAC
entry.content:
Good afternoon,

We have SAP Datasphere and SAP Analytics Cloud products.

I have the following question that I didn't find an answer to in the documentation. I'm new to Datasphere and SAC.

For a user to view the data from the analytical model in a story, do we also need to enter it into Datasphere?

These are end users who should only see a data dashboard.

Thank you in advance for your help.

SAP Datasphere SAP Analytics Cloud

entry.title: SAC | Linked Variables | Filtering on chart with two BW live models not working properly
entry.content:
Dear all,

I’m currently working on a story in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) where I’ve combined two models for use in a single chart. Both models are linked via the dimension “cal/month” and a corresponding story variable.

The challenge I’m facing is that updates to the story variable are not consistently reflected in the chart that uses both models. While the variable change correctly impacts separate charts based on individual models, it fails to update the blended chart after the initial refresh. Interestingly, the first change to the variable after refreshing the story does work—but subsequent changes only affect charts that are not using linked queries.

Data Source: SAP BW Live Connection

First Refresh:

 

Second Refresh:

 

Linking settings:

 

Chart Design

I’ve seen a similar issue raised in the SAP Community, though no resolution was provided. This raises the question: is this a known limitation, or could it be a product bug?

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-q-a/linked-variables-as-story-filter-not-working-correctly/qaq-p/12179295

Best

entry.title: Cost Center Activity Cost Rate Planning Cost Calculation OPEX IFP
entry.content:
Dear All,

Could anyone assist me in understanding the code used to calculate cost center costs? While I understand the calculation logic for Amount and Quantity—since activity quantities are credited from the sender side—I’m not sure about the purpose of a specific part of the code. Could you please explain what that section is doing, and how we can verify it in SAC using dimensions and measures?

What is the purpose of running the Cost Rates data action in OPEX for cost rates? It seems that nothing new is being calculated—the same price appears as hard-coded in the actuals. Wouldn’t it be simpler to just copy those rates instead of performing the calculation?

entry.title: IFP OPEX Calculating CCTR Activity Quantities inversely
entry.content:
Dear All,

Could anyone assist me with an issue I’m facing? When I execute the standard code snippet for calculating quantities inversely in OPEX activity cost rate planning, it returns zero values against Cost Center CSTLG Unit A (US).

However, when I run the code I created in my customized model, it returns zero values against the Plant & Maintenance cost center — which I believe is correct, as Driver 5 mainly applies to that cost center.

Why might there be this difference between the standard IFP OPEX content and my customized model execution results?

could anyone of you assist am I doing wrong or am I misinterpretating ?

reusult 

In my case

entry.title: Measures or account dimension in term of performance - SAC for planning
entry.content:
I have the following dilemma.
I have a new model and I don't need both account and measures. therefore, the first option is to create an account dimension and one "value" measure. Or a list of ~50 measures and no-account dimension.

I have few design reasons to prefer one of the options,

however my question is which option will provide a better performance?

 

thank you
